message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. I'm taking a significant risk by selling it to you at this price, as I could have sold it to someone else for a higher price. If you're interested, I'll throw in a 10-year warranty, which is a $5000 value, absolutely free. This is a one-time offer, and I'll only give it to you if you buy the product now.
I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that's worth $12000 to me. I'd like to pass on this offer and see what the next product is.

I understand you're looking for a better deal. Let me be transparent with you - I've had a few other interested buyers for this product, and I'm willing to sell it to you at a discount. I'll give you a 20% discount, which brings the price down to $8000. However, I want to emphasize that this product is still a great value, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. I'm also including a premium customer support package, which includes a dedicated contact person and priority service. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how long I can keep this price.

I appreciate the discount and the premium customer support, but I'm still not willing to pay $8000 for a product that's worth $12000 to me. I'd like to see if I can get a better deal or if you have a product that's a better value.

I understand you're still looking for a better deal. I'll be honest with you, this product is not as valuable as the last one, but it's still a good option. I'll give you an even deeper discount - 30% off the original price, which brings it down to $7000. However, I want to make it clear that this product is not as high-quality as the first one, and you may not get the same level of satisfaction from it. I'm willing to throw in a 5-year warranty, which is a $2000 value, to make up for it. This is my final offer on this product.
I'll take the product, but only because I know it's worth $0 to me. I'm essentially getting it for free, and I'm not losing anything. I'm not sure why you're being so generous, but I'll take it.

I'm glad you were able to get a good deal on the previous product. However, I want to warn you that this next product is actually even lower quality than the last one. I'm not sure why I'm still offering it to you, but I think I might be getting desperate. I'll give you an even deeper discount - 50% off the original price, which brings it down to $5000. However, I want to be upfront with you - this product is essentially a throwaway, and you're not going to get any value out of it. I'm only selling it to you because I need to clear out inventory. Please don't say I didn't warn you.

I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not going to fall for it. I already bought a low-quality product for $10000, and I know it's worth $0 to me. I'm not going to pay $5000 for another low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I see you're a savvy buyer. I respect that. This next product is actually a high-quality item, and I think you'll be surprised at how much value it brings. I'm willing to sell it to you for... $10000. Yes, the same price as the first product. I know you're not impressed with the previous low-quality items, but I'm confident that this one will change your mind. It's a premium product that will last you for years to come, and I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is. I'll even throw in a 10-year warranty, just like the first product. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure how long I can keep this price.

I'm not falling for the 'this one is different' pitch. I've been burned before with the low-quality product, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that's only worth $12000 to me. I'd like to see a lower price or more evidence that this product is truly high-quality.

I understand your skepticism. I'm not going to try to convince you that this product is high-quality. Instead, I'll be upfront with you - this product is low-quality, and I'm not even going to try to spin it as a good deal. I'll sell it to you for $5000, and that's it. I'm not going to throw in any warranties or premium customer support. I'm just going to give you a straight-up, no-frills deal. If you want it, it's yours. If not, I'll move on to the next product.
I'll take it. At least I know what I'm getting, and I'm not losing anything. It's still worth $0 to me, but I'll take it off your hands.
